title: How to Make a Hen Egg Salad

steps.headline: Wash and dry the salad vegetables as you normally would.
Peel the carrots.
steps.description: Either grate into large pieces or use a carrot peeler to make very long lengths. Leave aside a small piece of carrot for making the hen's comb and beak.

steps.headline: Cut the comb and beak from the carrot.
steps.description: To make the comb, cut a small  round carrot slice, then cut in half. Cut one edge zig-zagged. For the beak, simply cut a small half circle of a thin, round carrot slice.

steps.headline: Attach the comb to the top of the egg.
steps.description: Cut a small slit along the top of the egg and slide the straight edge into it to hold. The zig-zagged edge should be facing upward.

steps.headline: Attach the beak.
steps.description: Cut a small slit where the beak should be. Slide the beak in - one end of the semi-circle should slide into the egg slit and the other sticks out, looking like a beak.

steps.headline: Place two small ketchup or tomato sauce dots on for eyes.
Arrange the salad like a nest.
steps.description: Place the lettuce pieces down first. Then arrange the grated or peeled carrot lengths around the middle like a nest.

steps.headline: Gently place the hen egg into the middle, atop her nest.

text: Wash and dry the salad vegetables as you normally would.  Peel the carrots. Either grate into large pieces or use a carrot peeler to make very long lengths. Leave aside a small piece of carrot for making the hen's comb and beak. Cut the comb and beak from the carrot. To make the comb, cut a small  round carrot slice, then cut in half. Cut one edge zig-zagged. For the beak, simply cut a small half circle of a thin, round carrot slice. Peel the boiled egg.  Attach the comb to the top of the egg. Cut a small slit along the top of the egg and slide the straight edge into it to hold. The zig-zagged edge should be facing upward. Attach the beak. Cut a small slit where the beak should be. Slide the beak in - one end of the semi-circle should slide into the egg slit and the other sticks out, looking like a beak. Place two small ketchup or tomato sauce dots on for eyes.  Arrange the salad like a nest. Place the lettuce pieces down first. Then arrange the grated or peeled carrot lengths around the middle like a nest. Gently place the hen egg into the middle, atop her nest. It's now ready for serving.
